midas/examples/basic/msgdump.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         msgdump.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     MIDAS message dump program. Attaches to the system
00007                 message buffer and extracts messages.
00008 
00009   $Log: msgdump.c,v $
00010   Revision 1.1.1.1  2005/06/20 23:37:10  mucap
00011   Importing release 1.9.5 of the MIDAS source code as distributed by PSI.
00012   (Next, I'll commit our local customizations.)
00013 
00014   Revision 1.3  2004/01/08 08:40:08  midas
00015   Implemented standard indentation
00016 
00017   Revision 1.2  1998/10/12 12:18:58  midas
00018   Added Log tag in header
00019 
00020 
00021 \********************************************************************/
00022 
00023 #include "midas.h"
00024 #include "msystem.h"
00025 
00026 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00027 
00028 char *type_name[] = {
00029    "ERROR",
00030    "INFO",
00031    "DEBUG" "USER",
00032    "LOG",
00033    "TALK",
00034    "CALL",
00035 };
00036 
00037 main(int argc, char **argv)
00038 {
00039    int msg_buf, i, status, size, id;
00040    char event[10000];
00041    EVENT_HEADER *pheader;
00042    BUFFER_HEADER buffer_header;
00043    char *pstring;
00044    char type_string[100];
00045    FILE *f;
00046 
00047    if (argc < 2) {
00048       printf("Usage: msgdump [-dwc]                             \n");
00049       printf("                                                  \n");
00050       printf("       -d display messages on screen              \n");
00051       printf("       -c display clients producing messages      \n");
00052       printf("       -w write messages to MSGDUMP.ASC           \n\n");
00053       return 1;
00054    }
00055 
00056    status = cm_connect_experiment("", "", "MsgDump", NULL);
00057    if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
00058       return 1;
00059 
00060    bm_open_buffer(MESSAGE_BUFFER_NAME, MESSAGE_BUFFER_SIZE, &msg_buf);
00061 
00062    bm_get_buffer_info(msg_buf, &buffer_header);
00063 
00064    bm_request_event(msg_buf, EVENTID_ALL, TRIGGER_ALL, GET_SOME, &id, NULL);
00065 
00066    pstring = event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
00067    pheader = (EVENT_HEADER *) event;
00068 
00069    if (argv[1][1] == 'd') {
00070       printf("Displaying messages. Hit Ctrl-C to abort.\n");
00071       printf("=========================================\n\n");
00072 
00073       do {
00074          size = 10000;
00075          status = bm_receive_event(msg_buf, event, &size, SYNC);
00076 
00077          if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
00078             printf("Error receiving event.\n");
00079             return 0;
00080          }
00081 
00082          type_string[0] = 0;
00083          for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
00084             if (pheader->trigger_mask & (1 << i))
00085                strcat(type_string, type_name[i]);
00086 
00087          printf("serial %d, type %s, time %1.3lf\n",
00088                 pheader->serial_number, type_string, pheader->time_stamp / 1000.0);
00089          printf("%s\n\n", pstring);
00090       } while (1);
00091    }
00092 
00093    if (argv[1][1] == 'c') {
00094       printf("Clients attached to current message system:\n");
00095       printf("===========================================\n\n");
00096 
00097       for (i = 0; i < buffer_header.max_client_index; i++)
00098          if (buffer_header.client[i].pid)
00099             printf("#%d: pid=%d name=%s\n", i, buffer_header.client[i].pid,
00100                    buffer_header.client[i].name);
00101    }
00102 
00103    if (argv[1][1] == 'w') {
00104       printf("Message collecting active, hit ENTER to stop.\n");
00105 
00106       getchar();
00107 
00108       printf("Writing MSGDUMP.ASC ...\n");
00109 
00110       f = fopen("MSGDUMP.ASC", "w");
00111 
00112       bm_get_buffer_info(msg_buf, &buffer_header);
00113 
00114       do {
00115          size = 10000;
00116          status = bm_receive_event(msg_buf, event, &size, ASYNC);
00117          if (status == BM_ASYNC_RETURN) {
00118             fclose(f);
00119             break;
00120          }
00121 
00122          type_string[0] = 0;
00123          for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
00124             if (pheader->trigger_mask & (1 << i))
00125                strcat(type_string, type_name[i]);
00126 
00127          fprintf(f, "serial %d, type %s, time %1.3lf\n",
00128                  pheader->serial_number, type_string, pheader->time_stamp / 1000.0);
00129          fprintf(f, "%s\n\n", pstring);
00130       } while (1);
00131    }
00132 
00133 
00134    cm_disconnect_experiment();
00135    return 1;
00136 }
